A header containing the deprecation date of the underlying endpoint. For more information, please refer to the deprecation header RFC:
https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-dalal-deprecation-header-01.html

RequestIdResponseHeader.description: A header containing a unique id used for tracking this request. If you are reporting an issue to Snyk it's very helpful to provide this ID.

SunsetHeader.description:
A header containing the date of when the underlying endpoint will be removed. This header is only present if the endpoint has been deprecated. Please refer to the RFC for more information:
https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8594

VersionRequestedResponseHeader.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint requested by the caller.

VersionStageResponseHeader.description: A header containing the version stage of the endpoint. This stage describes the guarantees snyk provides surrounding stability of the endpoint.

StartingAfter.description: Return the page of results immediately after this cursor
StartingAfter.name: starting_after

204.description: The operation completed successfully with no content

400.description: Bad Request: A parameter provided as a part of the request was invalid.

401.description: Unauthorized: the request requires an authentication token.

403.description: Forbidden: the request requires an authentication token with more or different permissions.

404.description: Not Found: The resource being operated on could not be found.

409.description: Conflict: The requested operation conflicts with the current state of the resource in some way.

500.description: Internal Server Error: An error was encountered while attempting to process the request.

AccessTokenTTLSeconds.description: The access token time to live for your app, in seconds. It only affects the newly generated access tokens, existing access token will  continue to have their previous time to live as expiration.

AppName.description: New name of the app to display to users during authorization flow.

AutoDependencyUpgradeSettings.description: Automatically create pull requests on recurring tests for dependencies as upgrades become available. If not specified, settings will be inherited from the Project's integration.

ignored_dependencies.description: Dependencies which should NOT be included in an automatic upgrade operation.

is_enabled.description: Automatically raise pull requests to update out-of-date dependencies.

is_inherited.description: Apply the auto dependency integration settings of the Organization to this project.

is_major_upgrade_enabled.description: Include major version in dependency upgrade recommendation.

limit.description: Limit of dependency upgrade PRs which can be opened simultaneously. When the limit is reached, no new upgrade PRs are created. If specified, must be between 1 and 10.

minimum_age.description: Minimum dependency maturity period in days. If specified, must be between 1 and 365.

AutoRemediationPRsSettings.description: Automatically raise pull requests on recurring tests to fix new and existing vulnerabilities. If not specified, settings will be inherited from the Project's integration.

is_backlog_prs_enabled.description: Automatically create pull requests on scheduled tests for known (backlog) vulnerabilities.

is_fresh_prs_enabled.description: Automatically create pull requests on scheduled tests for new vulnerabilities.

is_patch_remediation_enabled.description: Include vulnerability patches in automatic pull requests.

purls.description: An array of Package URLs (purl). Supported purl types are apk, cargo, cocoapods, composer, deb, gem, generic, hex, maven, npm, nuget, pypi, rpm, and swift. A version for the package is also required.

ClientId.description: The oauth2 client id for the app.

ClientSecret.description: The oauth2 client secret for the app. This is the only time this secret will be returned, store it securely and don’t lose it.

updated_at.description: When the vulnerability information was last modified.

status.description: Describes if a project is currently monitored or it is de-activated.

PullRequestAssignmentSettings.description: Automatically assign pull requests created by Snyk (limited to private repos). If not specified, settings will be inherited from the Project's integration.

assignees.description: Manually specify users to assign (and all will be assigned).

is_enabled.description: Automatically assign pull requests created by Snyk.

type.description: Automatically assign the last user to change the manifest file ("auto"), or manually specify a list of users ("manual").

PullRequestsSettings.description: Settings which describe how pull requests for a project are tested.

fail_only_for_issues_with_fix.description: Only fail when the issues found have a fix available.

policy.description: Fail if the project has any issues ("all"), or fail if a PR is introducing a new dependency with issues ("only_new").

severity_threshold.description: Only fail for issues greater than or equal to the specified severity.

RecurringTestsSettings.description: Settings which describe how recurring tests are run for a project.

frequency.description: Test frequency of a project. Also controls when automated PRs may be created.

RedirectURIs.description: List of allowed redirect URIs to call back after authentication.

description.description: A markdown-formatted optional description of this remedy.

upgrade_package.description: A minimum version to upgrade to in order to remedy the issue.

type.description: The type of the remedy. Always ‘indeterminate’.

score.description: The CVSSv3 value of the vulnerability.

source.description: The source of this severity. The value must be the id of a referenced problem or class, in which case that problem or class is the source of this issue. If source is omitted, this severity is sourced internally in the Snyk application.

vector.description: The CVSSv3 value of the vulnerability.

disclosure_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was disclosed.

exploit.description: The exploit maturity. Value of ‘No Data’, ‘Not Defined’, ‘Unproven’, ‘Proof of Concept’, ‘Functional’ or ‘High’.

publication_time.description: The time at which this vulnerability was published.

title.description: Descriptor for an external reference to the issue

url.description: URL for an external reference to the issue

display_name.description: The human readable name that represents this target. These are generated based on the provided properties, and the source. In the future we may support updating this value.

url.description: The URL for the resource. We do not use this as part of our representation of the identity of the target, as it can      be changed externally to Snyk We are reliant on individual integrations providing us with this value. Currently it is only provided by the CLI

get.description:
This endpoint lets you retrieve the SBOM document of a software project.
It supports the following formats:
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in JSON (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+json`).
* CycloneDX version 1.4 in XML (set `format` to `cyclonedx1.4+xml`).
* SPDX version 2.3 in JSON (set `format` to `spdx2.3+json`).

By default it will respond with an empty JSON:API response.

200.description: Returns the SBOM document of a project

https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8594

code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The request was missing these required fields: ...

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

parameter.description: A string indicating which URI query parameter caused the error.

pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document.

status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem that SHOULD NOT change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

version.description: Version of the JSON API specification this server supports.

409.description: Conflict: The requested operation conflicts with the current state of the resource in some way.

deprecation.description:
A header containing the deprecation date of the underlying endpoint. For more information, please refer to the deprecation header RFC:
https://tools.ietf.org/id/draft-dalal-deprecation-header-01.html

snyk-request-id.description: A header containing a unique id used for tracking this request. If you are reporting an issue to Snyk it's very helpful to provide this ID.

snyk-version-lifecycle-stage.description: A header containing the version stage of the endpoint. This stage describes the guarantees snyk provides surrounding stability of the endpoint.

snyk-version-requested.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint requested by the caller.

snyk-version-served.description: A header containing the version of the endpoint that was served by the API.
